title: CodeType — Coding Typing Test Web Application

requirements.text: Create a multi-page React application with a persistent navigation sidebar/topbar containing links to: Home, Practice, Learn, Test, Progress/Stats, Challenges, Profile, and Settings. Navigation must be fully responsive (hamburger menu on mobile).

quotes: it should contain pages like home, progress/stats, practice, challenges, profile, test, settings

acceptanceCriteria: All 8 pages are accessible from the navigation
Active page is visually highlighted in the nav
Navigation collapses to a hamburger menu on mobile screens
Navigation persists across all pages

requirements.text: Build the Home page with: (1) a hero section introducing the app as a coding-focused typing trainer with a headline, brief description, and a prominent 'Start Typing' CTA button that navigates to the Practice page; (2) a Features Overview section showcasing key app features with icons and short descriptions; (3) a Contact/Feedback section with a simple form (name, email, message fields) and a submit button.

quotes: homepage it should contain website intro, start typing (it should redirect to practice page), contact/feedback, features overview

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section renders with headline and CTA button
Clicking 'Start Typing' navigates to the Practice page
Features Overview section displays at least 4 features with icons
Contact/Feedback form renders with name, email, message fields and submit button
Home page is responsive across all screen sizes

requirements.text: Build the Practice page with: (1) a typing area displaying a code snippet where typed characters are highlighted correct (green) or incorrect (red) in real time; (2) live WPM and accuracy metrics displayed above or beside the typing area; (3) a language selector with options: Java, C, HTML/CSS, Python, SQL; (4) a difficulty selector with options: Easy, Medium, Hard — difficulty affects snippet complexity and length; (5) a Reset/New Snippet button.

quotes: practice page it should contain start typing where it should provide space for test typing speed along with wpm accuracy, option with practice by language where languages should be provided (java, c, html/css, python, sql etc) also mention difficulty level like easy medium hard

acceptanceCriteria: Typing area renders a code snippet monospace font
Each keystroke immediately colors the character green (correct) or red (incorrect)
WPM updates in real time during typing
Accuracy percentage updates in real time
Language selector has Java, C, HTML/CSS, Python, SQL options
Difficulty selector has Easy, Medium, Hard options
Changing language or difficulty loads a new appropriate snippet
Reset button restarts the current snippet

requirements.text: Build the Learn page with four informational sections: (1) Typing Tips for Programmers — a list of actionable tips specific to coding; (2) Finger Placement Guide — a visual or descriptive guide for proper finger positioning on the keyboard; (3) Common Coding Mistakes — a list of frequent errors coders make while typing (e.g., bracket mismatch, wrong indentation syntax); (4) Keyboard Shortcuts — a reference table of common IDE/editor shortcuts (VS Code, general terminal, etc.).

quotes: in learn page add typing tips for programmers, finger placement guide, common coding mistakes, keyboard short cuts

acceptanceCriteria: All four sections are present and labeled clearly
Typing Tips section has at least 5 tips
Finger Placement Guide section has a clear visual or diagram description
Common Coding Mistakes section has at least 5 entries
Keyboard Shortcuts section renders a structured table with shortcut + description columns
Page is readable and responsive

requirements.text: Build the Test page with four test modes selectable via tabs or cards: (1) Timed Test — user types as much code as possible within a chosen countdown (15s, 30s, 60s, 120s); (2) Speed Test — user types a fixed snippet as fast as possible, timer runs until completion; (3) Accuracy Test — user must reach a target accuracy percentage (e.g., 95%) with strict error feedback; (4) Custom Test — user can input their own code snippet to type. All modes display final WPM, accuracy, and time on completion.

quotes: test page with timed test, speed test, accuracy test, custom test

acceptanceCriteria: Four test modes are accessible via tabs or mode selector cards
Timed Test mode has duration options (15s, 30s, 60s, 120s) and counts down
Speed Test mode starts timer on first keystroke and stops on completion
Accuracy Test mode enforces a minimum accuracy threshold
Custom Test mode has a textarea for pasting user's own code snippet
Results screen shows WPM, accuracy, and elapsed/remaining time after each test

requirements.text: Implement backend storage for test results. Each completed test session should persist: timestamp, WPM, accuracy, test mode, language, difficulty, and duration. Expose query functions to retrieve all sessions for stats display.

quotes: progress/ stats page with wpm history, accuracy graph, daily streaks

acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor stores test result records with all required fields
saveResult update function accepts and stores a test result
getResults query function returns all stored results
Data persists across canister upgrades

requirements.text: Build the Progress/Stats page that reads from the backend to display: (1) WPM History — a line chart showing WPM over time across sessions; (2) Accuracy Graph — a line or bar chart showing accuracy percentage over sessions; (3) Daily Streaks — a streak counter and a calendar heatmap showing days the user completed at least one test; (4) Summary stats: best WPM, average WPM, total tests taken, average accuracy.

quotes: progress/ stats page with wpm history, accuracy graph, daily streaks

acceptanceCriteria: WPM history chart renders with session data points
Accuracy graph renders with session data points
Daily streak counter shows current streak
Calendar heatmap or similar visualization shows active test days
Summary stats (best WPM, avg WPM, total tests, avg accuracy) are displayed
Charts and stats update when new test results are saved

requirements.text: Build the Challenges page with three challenge categories: (1) Daily Challenges — a rotating set of daily typing challenges (e.g., type a Python snippet in under 60s with 90% accuracy); (2) Weekly Challenges — longer or harder challenges that reset weekly; (3) Level-Based Challenges — a progression of challenges from beginner to expert with clear level indicators. Each challenge card shows: title, description, requirements, and a 'Start Challenge' button that launches the appropriate test.

quotes: challenges page with daily challenges, weekly challenges, level based challenges

acceptanceCriteria: Three sections: Daily, Weekly, and Level-Based are clearly separated
Each challenge renders as a card with title, description, and requirements
'Start Challenge' button launches the test with the challenge configuration
Level-Based challenges show progression (e.g., Level 1 through Level 10)
Daily and Weekly challenges show a reset timer or refresh date

requirements.text: Build a Profile page displaying: user's display name (editable), avatar placeholder, lifetime stats summary (total tests, best WPM, avg accuracy, current streak), and recent test history as a table.

quotes: pages like home, progress/stats, practice, challenges, profile, test, settings

acceptanceCriteria: Profile page displays display name with an edit option
Avatar placeholder is shown
Lifetime stats section shows total tests, best WPM, avg accuracy, streak
Recent activity table shows last 10 test results with date, WPM, accuracy, mode

requirements.text: Implement a global Settings panel accessible from every page (via a settings icon/button in the navigation). Settings must include: (1) Light/Dark mode toggle — applies theme globally and persists in localStorage; (2) Font Size control — slider or +/- buttons to increase/decrease the font size of the typing area and UI text (range: small, medium, large, x-large); (3) Font Style selector — dropdown populated with Google Fonts (at minimum: Fira Code, JetBrains Mono, Source Code Pro, Roboto Mono, Ubuntu Mono) applied to the typing area; (4) Backspace Allowed toggle — when OFF, the Backspace key is disabled during typing tests and practice.

quotes: add settings to every page with light/dark mode , font size to increase or decrease font size, font style to change font style use google fonts, backspace allowed toggle where it should control backspace key

acceptanceCriteria: Settings panel or page is reachable from navigation on every page
Light/Dark mode toggle switches the entire app theme
Theme preference persists across page refreshes via localStorage
Font size control has at least 4 size levels and updates text throughout the app
Font style dropdown lists at least 5 Google Fonts monospace options and applies to the typing area
Backspace Allowed toggle, when disabled, prevents the backspace key from deleting characters during typing
All settings persist in localStorage

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive dark-tech / terminal-inspired visual theme across the entire application: deep dark backgrounds (near-black/charcoal), neon accent colors (e.g., electric green or cyan), monospace typography for code elements, card-based layouts with subtle borders and glows, smooth transitions and hover states. Ensure the light mode variant uses off-white/light gray backgrounds with muted accent tones. Typography hierarchy should be clean and modern.

quotes: make it responsive for any device

acceptanceCriteria: Dark mode uses deep charcoal/near-black backgrounds with neon accent colors
Light mode uses clean off-white/gray backgrounds with complementary accents
Code snippets and typing areas use a monospace Google Font
Cards, buttons, and interactive elements have consistent styling with hover/focus states
Theme is applied consistently across all pages

requirements.text: Ensure the entire application is fully responsive across all device sizes: mobile (320px+), tablet (768px+), and desktop (1024px+). Navigation collapses on mobile, typing areas scale appropriately, charts and stats reflow on smaller screens, and touch interactions are supported for the typing area.

quotes: make it responsive for any device

acceptanceCriteria: Layout renders correctly at 320px, 768px, and 1280px widths
No horizontal overflow on any page at mobile widths
Charts resize and remain readable on mobile
Typing area is usable on touch devices
Navigation is usable on all screen sizes

constraints: All Motoko logic must remain in a single actor in backend/main.mo
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
Google Fonts must be loaded via CSS @import or link tag, not via a third-party npm package that requires API keys
Settings (theme, font size, font style, backspace toggle) must persist in localStorage on the frontend only
nonGoals: User authentication or Internet Identity login
Backend storage for settings (settings are client-side only)
Mobile native app or PWA features
External API integrations for code snippets (snippets are hardcoded)

required: Dark terminal-style hero background with faint green matrix-like code characters on a deep charcoal gradient (hero-bg.dim_1440x800.png)
Keyboard diagram illustration showing finger placement zones in neon color-coded regions on a dark background (finger-placement.dim_800x300.png)
App logo mark — a minimalist glowing cursor symbol combined with angle brackets forming a code icon (logo-icon.dim_128x128.png)
